node.title: Lin-Manuel Miranda blends Broadway theatrics with vibrant Colombian music in Disney’s Encanto
node.alt: Animated brown girl with big glasses, curly dark hair, butterfly-patterned white blouse and teal skirt stands with six donkeys.
node.description: A misfit teen from a magical family finds her own rhythm in this sweet-natured coming-of-age movie, which represents Disney’s first serious engagement with modern Latin American culture.
node.content:
["Disney's latest feature animation \u2013 their milestone 60th \u2013 is a Latin American affair, a magic realist fable that celebrates family, culture, and the seemingly inescapable sounds of Lin-Manuel Miranda, the multi-hyphenate performer who co-wrote the story and provides the vibrant musical numbers.", "The Hamilton creator has had a rollercoaster year, issuing an apology for the alleged colourism in the film adaptation of his musical In the Heights, playing an animated, all-singing Cuban kinkajou, and bouncing back with the sustained critical praise for his widely Oscar-tipped directorial debut, Tick, Tick\u2026 Boom!.", "His grab bag of musical styles \u2013 theatre-kid belters, grandma-friendly hip hop, cross-pollinated Latin jams \u2013 gets an exuberant workout in Encanto, a sweet-natured coming-of-age movie that puts the music, dancing and culture of Latin America at the fore.", "", "
Stephanie Beatriz, who voices Mirabel,\u00a0played\u00a0Carla in the film adaptation of Lin-Manuel Miranda's hit musical In The Heights.(Supplied: Disney)
", "This upbeat confection begins with a surprisingly dark prelude, in which a community of people are driven from their homeland by Spanish invaders \u2013 a tale of indigenous dispossession that anchors the ensuing whimsy.", "Having lost her husband, the future Abuela Madrigal (voiced by Mar\u00eda Cecilia Botero) flees into the Colombian mountains, where she's blessed with a magic candle and an enchanted village.", "The sprawling family house, known as Casita, is a personality unto itself: helping out with the chores, providing emotional support, and laying down the rhythm tracks for the film's musical sequences \u2013 like some extremely benign version of the impish mansion in Nobuhiko Obayashi's cult horror, House (1977).", "In a breathless all-cast overture, we meet our hero, Abuela's granddaughter Mirabel (Stephanie Beatriz, In the Heights; Brooklyn Nine-Nine), a bespectacled teenage empath who introduces the many marvellous members of her extended family \u2013 three generations who each have their special gifts that help them watch over the local community.", "", "
\"I think the best family entertainment gives families an entirely new vocabulary to talk about after the movie,\" Miranda told ABC News Breakfast.(Supplied: Disney)
", "Mirabel's mum, Julieta (Angie Cepeda), can heal with her tasty cooking; aunt Pepa (Carolina Gait\u00e1n), trailed by a comical raincloud, can control the weather. Yassified older sister Isabela (Diane Guerrero) makes flowers and hearts bloom, middle sister Luisa (Jessica Darrow) possesses super-strength, and teenage cousin Camilo (Rhenzy Feliz) is a shapeshifter who hasn't decided upon his final form \u2013 a nice enough metaphor for fluid identity, and also a great vehicle for a string of animation sight gags.", "Everyone in the family has a gift \u2013 everyone, that is, except Mirabel.", "\"Maybe your gift is 'living in denial',\" giggles one of the kids in the opening number's Greek chorus.", "But when cracks start appearing in Casita's walls and the candle's flame flickers, everyone's magic powers begin to wane \u2013 and it's Mirabel who holds the key to saving the family.", "", "
\u201cIt\u2019s a story about how the people who are closest to us don\u2019t always see us\u2014or fully understand us,\" said Bush in press notes.(Supplied: Disney)
", "It seems the only person who can help her is her mysterious uncle Bruno \u2013 voiced by the always enjoyable John Leguizamo \u2013 a crackpot loner whose visions of the future have seen him cast out from the family.", "As penned by screenwriters Charise Castro Smith (Sweetbitter) and Jared Bush (Moana), Mirabel's journey of self-discovery \u2013 yet another generic tale of believing in yourself \u2013 is pretty rote, as far as these movies go.", "But Encanto's appeal lies less in its narrative than its festival of Colombian culture \u2013 albeit delivered via a glossy Disney lens.", "The film's rubbery computer-generated animation, co-directed by Bush (Zootopia) and Byron Howard (Tangled), is lushly detailed, with amusing caricatures and multicoloured landscapes that teem with local flora and fauna \u2013 toucans, tapirs, coatis, capybaras and jaguars that each deserve their own standalone adventure.", "", "
Miranda wrote and produced eight original songs for the film with co-producer Mike Elizondo, while the score was composed by Germaine Franco.\u00a0(Supplied: Disney)
", "If there's a touch of Colombian magic realism to it all, it's no surprise to discover that Miranda was inspired in part by novelist and genre grandaddy, Gabriel Garc\u00eda M\u00e1rquez.", "And unlike In the Heights' much-debated representation of Dominicans, the Madrigal family in Encanto include a visible mix of Afro Latino, Indigenous and mixed-race members \u2013 reflective of the ethnic diversity of Colombia.", "The film's cultural specificity is significant.", "You have to go all the way back to Disney's first decade of feature animation, and the touristic double of Saludos Amigos (1942) and The Three Caballeros (1944), to find the studio explicitly engaging with modern Latin American culture \u2013 and even then, the characters are mostly goofy, if endearing talking birds (several Latino stars of the era voiced roles).", "Together with a lively score from composer Germaine Franco (Coco; Dora and the Lost City of Gold), Miranda's songs here pay tribute to the rich array of sounds from the region, incorporating everything from cumbia and mapall\u00e9 to salsa and reggaeton \u2013 plus a traditional folk-style tune performed by Colombian star Carlos Vives.", "Even the requisite Disney-princess-style showstopper \u2013 sung by Beatriz in the animation studio's paint-peeling vocal tradition \u2013 is based around Colombian instruments playing in a waltz time signature.", "", "
\u201cWe couldn\u2019t have cast anybody better. [Beatriz] came to us with Mirabel\u2019s humor, vulnerability and openheartedness,\" Castro Smith said in press notes.(Supplied: Disney)
", "Miranda is in his element combining these traditional motifs with his penchant for Broadway theatrics, as in two of the film's highlights \u2013 We Don't Talk About Bruno, a gossipy shuffle that becomes a full-blown embrace of family madness, and Surface Pressure, a funky lament for society's expectations featuring brawny sister Luisa floating in a pink haze of fluffy clouds and unicorns.", "It's only when the music stops that the movie has a tendency to spin its wheels, and the lack of major dramatic stakes \u2013 no dastardly villains, no overarching love story \u2013 might prove underwhelming for some audiences.", "But more often than not the absence of a generic quest or perfunctory romance makes Encanto an interesting change of pace for a Disney feature animation.", "Rather than champion heroes and princesses, or give itself completely to the tedium of self-love, it's a modest, mostly charming diversion that embraces compassion, community, and yes \u2013 a little bit of enchantment.", "Encanto is in cinemas now."]
